verses.text:
Then the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said unto Moses , Go in unto Pharaoh , and tell him, Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of the Hebrews , Let my people go , that they may serve me.
For if thou refuse to let \add them\add* go , and wilt hold them still,

Behold, the hand of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* is upon thy cattle which \add is\add* in the field , upon the horses , upon the asses , upon the camels , upon the oxen , and upon the sheep : \add there shall be\add* a very grievous murrain.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall sever between the cattle of Israel and the cattle of Egypt : and there shall nothing die of all \add that is\add* the children’s of Israel.

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* appointed a set time , saying , To morrow the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall do this thing in the land.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* did that thing on the morrow , and all the cattle of Egypt died : but of the cattle of the children of Israel died not one.
And Pharaoh sent , and, behold, there was not one of the cattle of the Israelites dead. And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened , and he did not let the people go. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Moses and unto Aaron , Take to you handfuls of ashes of the furnace , and let Moses sprinkle it toward the heaven in the sight of Pharaoh.
And it shall become small dust in all the land of Egypt , and shall be a boil breaking forth \add with\add* blains upon man , and upon beast , throughout all the land of Egypt.
And they took ashes of the furnace , and stood before Pharaoh ; and Moses sprinkled it up toward heaven ; and it became a boil breaking forth \add with\add* blains upon man , and upon beast.
And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils ; for the boil was upon the magicians , and upon all the Egyptians.

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hardened the heart of Pharaoh , and he hearkened not unto them; as the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* had spoken unto Moses. \p

¶ And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said unto Moses , Rise up early in the morning , and stand before Pharaoh , and say unto him, Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of the Hebrews , Let my people go , that they may serve me.
For I will at this time send all my plagues upon thine heart , and upon thy servants , and upon thy people ; that thou mayest know that \add there is\add* none like me in all the earth.
For now I will stretch out my hand , that I may smite thee and thy people with pestilence ; and thou shalt be cut off from the earth.

And in very deed for this \add cause\add* have I raised thee up , for to shew \add in\add* thee my power ; and that my name may be declared throughout all the earth.\f + \fr 9.16 \ft raised…: Heb. made thee stand\f*
As yet exaltest thou thyself against my people , that thou wilt not let them go ?
Behold, to morrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very grievous hail , such as hath not been in Egypt since the foundation thereof even until now.

Send therefore now, \add and\add* gather thy cattle , and all that thou hast in the field ; \add for upon\add* every man and beast which shall be found in the field , and shall not be brought home , the hail shall come down upon them, and they shall die.
He that feared the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his cattle flee into the houses :
And he that regarded not the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* left his servants and his cattle in the field.\f + \fr 9.21 \ft regarded…: Heb. set not his heart unto\f* \p

¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Moses , Stretch forth thine hand toward heaven , that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt , upon man , and upon beast , and upon every herb of the field , throughout the land of Egypt.

And Moses stretched forth his rod toward heaven : and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* sent thunder and hail , and the fire ran along upon the ground ; and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* rained hail upon the land of Egypt.
So there was hail , and fire mingled with the hail , very grievous , such as there was none like it in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.
And the hail smote throughout all the land of Egypt all that \add was\add* in the field , both man and beast ; and the hail smote every herb of the field , and brake every tree of the field.
Only in the land of Goshen , where the children of Israel \add were\add*, was there no hail. \p

¶ And Pharaoh sent , and called for Moses and Aaron , and said unto them, I have sinned this time : the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* righteous , and I and my people \add are\add* wicked.

Intreat the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* (for \add it is\add* enough ) that there be no \add more\add* mighty thunderings and hail ; and I will let you go , and ye shall stay no longer.\f + \fr 9.28 \ft mighty…: Heb. voices of God\f*

And Moses said unto him, As soon as I am gone out of the city , I will spread abroad my hands unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; \add and\add* the thunder shall cease , neither shall there be any more hail ; that thou mayest know how that the earth \add is\add* the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
But as for thee and thy servants , I know that ye will not yet fear the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God.
And the flax and the barley was smitten : for the barley \add was\add* in the ear , and the flax \add was\add* bolled.
But the wheat and the rie were not smitten : for they \add were\add* not grown up.\f + \fr 9.32 \ft not grown…: Heb. hidden or, dark\f*
And Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh , and spread abroad his hands unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and the thunders and hail ceased , and the rain was not poured upon the earth.
And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders were ceased , he sinned yet more , and hardened his heart , he and his servants.

And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened , neither would he let the children of Israel go ; as the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had spoken by Moses.\f + \fr 9.35 \ft by Moses: Heb. by the hand of Moses\f*
